verses.arabic_tajweed_html: ٱلْحَآقَّةُ ١
verses.bangla: The Inevitable Hour!

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ ٢
verses.bangla: What is the Inevitable Hour?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَمَآ أَدْرَٮٰكَ مَا ٱلْحَآقَّةُ ٣
verses.bangla: What will explain to you what the Inevitable Hour is?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ وَعَادُۢ بِٱلْقَارِعَةِ ٤
verses.bangla: The people of Thamud and 'Ad denied that the crashing blowwould come:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَأَمَّا ثَمُودُ فَأُهْلِكُواْ بِٱلطَّاغِيَةِ ٥
verses.bangla: Thamud was destroyed by a deafening blast;

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَمَّا عَادٌ فَأُهْلِكُواْ بِرِيحٍ صَرْصَرٍ عَاتِيَةٍ ٦
verses.bangla: Ad was destroyed by a furious wind

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: سَخَّرَهَا عَلَيْهِمْ سَبْعَ لَيَالٍ وَثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَيَّامٍ حُسُومًا فَتَرَى ٱلْقَوْمَ فِيهَا صَرْعَىٰ كَأَنَّهُمْ أَعْجَازُ نَخْلٍ خَاوِيَةٍ ٧
verses.bangla: that God let loose against them for seven consecutive nights, eight consecutive days, so that you could have seen its people lying dead like hollow palm-trunks.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَهَلْ تَرَىٰ لَهُم مِّنۢ بَاقِيَةٍ ٨
verses.bangla: Can you see any trace of them now?

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَجَآءَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَن قَبْلَهُۥ وَٱلْمُؤْتَفِكَـٰتُ بِٱلْخَاطِئَةِ ٩
verses.bangla: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَعَصَوْاْ رَسُولَ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَهُمْ أَخْذَةً رَّابِيَةً ١٠
verses.bangla: these people committed grave sins and disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with an ever-tightening grip.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنَّا لَمَّا طَغَا ٱلْمَآءُ حَمَلْنَـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْجَارِيَةِ ١١
verses.bangla: But when the Flood rose high, We saved you in the floating ship,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: لِنَجْعَلَهَا لَكُمْ تَذْكِرَةً وَتَعِيَهَآ أُذُنٌ وَٲعِيَةٌ ١٢
verses.bangla: making that event a reminder for you: attentive ears may take heed.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَإِذَا نُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ نَفْخَةٌ وَٲحِدَةٌ ١٣
verses.bangla: When the Trumpet is sounded a single time,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَحُمِلَتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ وَٱلْجِبَالُ فَدُكَّتَا دَكَّةً وَٲحِدَةً ١٤
verses.bangla: when the earth and its mountains are raised high and then crushed with a single blow,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَيَوْمَئِذٍ وَقَعَتِ ٱلْوَاقِعَةُ ١٥
verses.bangla: on that Day the Great Event will come to pass.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَهِىَ يَوْمَئِذٍ وَاهِيَةٌ ١٦
verses.bangla: The sky will be torn apart on that Day, it will be so frail.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَٱلْمَلَكُ عَلَىٰٓ أَرْجَآئِهَا‌ۚ وَيَحْمِلُ عَرْشَ رَبِّكَ فَوْقَهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ ثَمَـٰنِيَةٌ ١٧
verses.bangla: The angels will be on all sides of it and, on that Day, eight of them will bear the throne of your Lord above them.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: يَوْمَئِذٍ تُعْرَضُونَ لَا تَخْفَىٰ مِنكُمْ خَافِيَةٌ ١٨
verses.bangla: On that Day you will be brought to judgement and none of your secrets will remain hidden.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ هَآؤُمُ ٱقْرَءُواْ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ ١٩
verses.bangla: Anyone who is given his Record in his right hand will say, ‘Here is my Record, read it.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنِّى ظَنَنتُ أَنِّى مُلَـٰقٍ حِسَابِيَهْ ٢٠
verses.bangla: I knew I would meet my Reckoning,’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَهُوَ فِى عِيشَةٍ رَّاضِيَةٍ ٢١
verses.bangla: and so he will have a pleasant life

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فِى جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٍ ٢٢
verses.bangla: in a lofty Garden,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: قُطُوفُهَا دَانِيَةٌ ٢٣
verses.bangla: with clustered fruit within his reach.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: كُلُواْ وَٱشْرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـــَٔۢا بِمَآ أَسْلَفْتُمْ فِى ٱلْأَيَّامِ ٱلْخَالِيَةِ ٢٤
verses.bangla: It will be said, ‘Eat and drink to your heart’s content as a reward for what you have done in days gone by.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَأَمَّا مَنْ أُوتِىَ كِتَـٰبَهُۥ بِشِمَالِهِۦ فَيَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى لَمْ أُوتَ كِتَـٰبِيَهْ ٢٥
verses.bangla: But anyone who is given his Record in his left hand will say, ‘If only I had never been given any Record

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَلَمْ أَدْرِ مَا حِسَابِيَهْ ٢٦
verses.bangla: and knew nothing of my Reckoning.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: يَـٰلَيْتَهَا كَانَتِ ٱلْقَاضِيَةَ ٢٧
verses.bangla: How I wish death had been the end of me.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنِّى مَالِيَهْۜ ٢٨
verses.bangla: My wealth has been no use to me,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: هَلَكَ عَنِّى سُلْطَـٰنِيَهْ ٢٩
verses.bangla: and my power has vanished.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: خُذُوهُ فَغُلُّوهُ ٣٠
verses.bangla: ‘Take him, put a collar on him,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: ثُمَّ ٱلْجَحِيمَ صَلُّوهُ ٣١
verses.bangla: lead him to burn in the blazing Fire,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: ثُمَّ فِى سِلْسِلَةٍ ذَرْعُهَا سَبْعُونَ ذِرَاعًا فَٱسْلُكُوهُ ٣٢
verses.bangla: and [bind him] in a chain seventy metres long:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لَا يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ ٣٣
verses.bangla: he would not believe in Almighty God,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلْمِسْكِينِ ٣٤
verses.bangla: he never encouraged feeding the hungry,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَلَيْسَ لَهُ ٱلْيَوْمَ هَـٰهُنَا حَمِيمٌ ٣٥
verses.bangla: so today he has no real friend here,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَلَا طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِنْ غِسْلِينٍ ٣٦
verses.bangla: and the only food he has is the filth

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: لَّا يَأْكُلُهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلْخَـٰطِــُٔونَ ٣٧
verses.bangla: that only sinners eat.’

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَلَآ أُقْسِمُ بِمَا تُبْصِرُونَ ٣٨
verses.bangla: So I swear by what you can see

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَمَا لَا تُبْصِرُونَ ٣٩
verses.bangla: and by what you cannot see:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوْلُ رَسُولٍ كَرِيمٍ ٤٠
verses.bangla: this [Quran] is the speech of an honoured messenger,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوْلِ شَاعِرٍ‌ۚ قَلِيلاً مَّا تُؤْمِنُونَ ٤١
verses.bangla: not the words of a poet- how little you believe!-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَلَا بِقَوْلِ كَاهِنٍ‌ۚ قَلِيلاً مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ ٤٢
verses.bangla: nor the words of a soothsayer- how little you reflect!

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: تَنزِيلٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ ٤٣
verses.bangla: This [Quran] is a message sent down from the Lord of the Worlds:

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَلَوْ تَقَوَّلَ عَلَيْنَا بَعْضَ ٱلْأَقَاوِيلِ ٤٤
verses.bangla: if [the Prophet] had attributed some fabrication to Us,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: لَأَخَذْنَا مِنْهُ بِٱلْيَمِينِ ٤٥
verses.bangla: We would certainly have seized his right hand

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: ثُمَّ لَقَطَعْنَا مِنْهُ ٱلْوَتِينَ ٤٦
verses.bangla: and cut off his lifeblood,

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَمَا مِنكُم مِّنْ أَحَدٍ عَنْهُ حَـٰجِزِينَ ٤٧
verses.bangla: and none of you could have defended him.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَتَذْكِرَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ ٤٨
verses.bangla: This [Quran] is a reminder for those who are aware of God.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَإِنَّا لَنَعْلَمُ أَنَّ مِنكُم مُّكَذِّبِينَ ٤٩
verses.bangla: We know that some of you consider it to be lies-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَسْرَةٌ عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ ٥٠
verses.bangla: this will be a source of bitter regret for the disbelievers-

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَحَقُّ ٱلْيَقِينِ ٥١
verses.bangla: but it is in fact the certain Truth.

verses.arabic_tajweed_html: فَسَبِّحْ بِٱسْمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلْعَظِيمِ ٥٢
verses.bangla: So [Prophet] glorify the name of your Lord, the Almighty.
